jparsec.observer

Class Observatory

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.observer.Observatory

  • public final class Observatory
extends java.lang.Object
    A convenient class for observatory data management. There are two main databases: the one from Sveshnikov, and the official Marsden list. The second one needs an external file located in a dependency.

    This data from Sveshnikov is the extension of Marsden's list of observatories published in Minor Planet Circulars. Additional data about observatories were taken from other sources to complete a list of 1200 observatories.

    Description of Sveshnikov catalog

    ATTENTION! These coordinates may be used for reduction of routinal observations with standard accuracy. For reduction of high accuracy observations (CCD, meridian obs., NEO objects) should be used more exact coordinates of instrument.

    Code / Reference

    1. list of MPC: nn.25665-25670, 25993, 26206, 26439, 26781, etc. (list of Marsden)
    2. "The Astronomical Year-Book for the year 1942",1941, p. 355-360, in Russian
    3. "The Astronomical Ephemeris for the year 1980", 1979, p. 472-496
    4. "The Astronomical Almanac for the year 2002", 2000, p. J1-J18
    5. "Connaissance des Temps pour l'an 1912", 1910, p.1*-104*
    6. "The Nautical Almanac for the year 1933", 1932
    7. "The Astronomical Ephemeris for the year 1974", 1973, p. 486-501
    8. D.A.O-Handley, Technical Report 32-1296, NASA, JPL, 1968, p. 2-3
    9. Various ref.: (Berliner AJ, 1949), (Observ. Astr., 1931) etc.

    Format

    Data is organised in arrays of type ObservatoryElement for each country, containing data objets with the convenient fields. Note that no information about time zone offset exists, so it is set a value of zero as default. So it is not recommended to use local time in ephemeris calculations as time scale.

    Reference

    This data is from M. L. Sveshnikov, IAA RAS. For details, see this page.

    It is hard to maintain this list completely updated. Some errors seems to exist, and at this time I have some observatories/instruments, like 291, 703, 678, which are not identified.

    Some other corrections made by T. Alonso Albi. Mainly names of certain countries, like 'Madagasgar' (Madagascar), 'Tadzhikistan' (Tajikistan), 'Malay' (Singapore), 'Ceylon' (Sri Lanka), 'Salvador' (El Salvador), 'Yugoslavia' (now Serbia) and Korea (now Korea of North and Korea of South). Political changes updated to 2011. I have changed also the location 'Youngchum' to 'Youngchun', in Korea.

    IMPORTANT: Perhaps some of the methods should be deprecated, since it is hard to update the list. Otherwise, support for the official Marsden list published in MPC is included also. In the Marsden list the reference field of the ObservatoryElement object is set equal to the original Marsden code, while field code is set to it's integer representation. Note that the position accuracy of the observatories in the Marsden list is not very good, since 5 decimal places (only 4 in Teide observatory!!!) in the parallax constants rho.sin(phi) and rho.cos(phi) can give errors above 200 m in the elevation.

    For this reason, the Sveshnikov data is still recommended when possible.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    ObservatoryElement, Country

    • Field Detail

      • observatories

        public static java.util.ArrayList<ObservatoryElement> observatories
        Holds the official list of observatories defined by Marsden. Note this array is static and not thread-safe, although this should not be a problem.

      • PATH_TO_OFFICIAL_LIST_OF_OBSERVATORIES_FROM_MPC

        public static final java.lang.String PATH_TO_OFFICIAL_LIST_OF_OBSERVATORIES_FROM_MPC
        Path to the file of observatories, including extension.

      • pathToFile

        public static java.lang.String pathToFile
        Path to an external file with observatories in the MPC format. This is optional, since JPARSEC contains an internal catalog from MPC.

    • Method Detail

      • getNumberOfObservatories

        public static int getNumberOfObservatories()
                                    throws JPARSECException
        Returns the number of observatories by Sveshnikov in the database.
        Returns:
        Number of cities, currently 1215.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs reading the observatories file.

      • getObservatoriesByCountry

        public static final ObservatoryElement[] getObservatoriesByCountry(Country.COUNTRY country_ID)
                                                            throws JPARSECException
        Get the observatories for certain country.
        Parameters:
        country_ID - The ID constant of the country whose observatories are required.
        Returns:
        The array ObservatoryElement[] containing observatories for the selected country, null if none is found.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs reading the observatories file.

      • getAllObservatories

        public static ObservatoryElement[] getAllObservatories()
                                                throws JPARSECException
        Get all observatories from Sveshnikov, not from Marsden list.
        Returns:
        The array containing all the observatories.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs reading the observatories file.

      • findObservatorybyName

        public static ObservatoryElement findObservatorybyName(java.lang.String obs_location)
                                                throws JPARSECException
        Find one observatory given the name of the place where it is located or part of it.
        Parameters:
        obs_location - The full/partial name of the mountain/city where the observatory is located.
        Returns:
        The object ObservatoryElement containing the observatory if it is found.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the observatory is not found.

      • findObservatorybyName

        public static ObservatoryElement findObservatorybyName(java.lang.String obs_location,
                                       Country.COUNTRY country)
                                                throws JPARSECException
        Find one observatory given the name of the place where it is located or part of it, and its country.
        Parameters:
        obs_location - The full/partial name of the mountain/city where the observatory is located.
        country - The country the desired location belongs to.
        Returns:
        The object ObservatoryElement containing the observatory if it is found.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the observatory is not found.

      • findObservatoryByPosition

        public static ObservatoryElement findObservatoryByPosition(LocationElement loc)
                                                    throws JPARSECException
        Search for an observatory by it's geographical position.
        Parameters:
        loc - Approximate position of the observatory.
        Returns:
        Closest observatory.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs reading the observatories file.

      • findCountry

        public static Country.COUNTRY findCountry(java.lang.String obs_location)
                                   throws JPARSECException
        Find the country where a given observatory is in.
        Parameters:
        obs_location - The full/partial name of the mountain/city where the observatory is located.
        Returns:
        The ID constant of the country, or null if no match is found.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the country cannot be found, and the warnings are to be treated as errors.

      • findObservatorybyCode

        public static ObservatoryElement findObservatorybyCode(int code)
                                                throws JPARSECException
        Deprecated. The method searchByCodeInMarsdenList(String) should be used instead.
        Find one observatory given the id code of B. Marsden. Note this method search for an integer code corresponding to the observatory in the database contained in JPARSEC (the old catalog by Sveshnikov). Current Marsden list contains non-integer codes, use the corresponding method to search in the updated list.
        Parameters:
        code - ID value for this observatory.
        Returns:
        The object ObservatoryElement containing the observatory if it is found.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the observatory is not found.

      • setPath

        public static void setPath(java.lang.String path)
        Sets the path to the file of observatories.
        Parameters:
        path - Full path including extension.

      • readFileOfObservatoriesFromExternalFile

        public static void readFileOfObservatoriesFromExternalFile()
                                                    throws JPARSECException
        Reads an external file with the observatories formatted in the standard way, stablished by the Minor Planet Center. This method should be the first to be called.

        An example of MPC format is: 

         000   0.0000 0.62411 +0.77873 Greenwich
        After the file is succesfully read, the elements are store in observatories vector. Note this array is static and not thread-safe.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the method fails.

      • parseObservatoryFromMarsdenList

        public static ObservatoryElement parseObservatoryFromMarsdenList(java.lang.String line)
                                                          throws JPARSECException
        Creates an ObservatoryElement object from a record of the file of observatories. This method uses the latest reference ellipsoid to transform from geocentric to geodetic coordinates.
        Parameters:
        line - Record to parse.
        Returns:
        ObservatoryElement object, or null if the observatory is not in Earth.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the method fails.

      • getNumberOfObservatoriesInMarsdenList

        public static int getNumberOfObservatoriesInMarsdenList()
        Obtain number of observatories in the Marsden list.
        Returns:
        Number of observatories.

      • getObservatoryFromMarsdenList

        public static ObservatoryElement getObservatoryFromMarsdenList(int index)
                                                        throws JPARSECException
        Obtains one observatory.
        Parameters:
        index - ID value for the observatory. From 0 to getNumberOfObservatoriesInMarsdenList()-1.
        Returns:
        The ObservatoryElement object.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the index is out of range.

      • searchByNameInMarsdenList

        public static int searchByNameInMarsdenList(java.lang.String observatory)
        Search for an observatory by it's name.
        Parameters:
        observatory - Name of the observatory to seach for.
        Returns:
        index value of the observatory. -1 is returned if no match is found.

      • searchByPositionInMarsdenList

        public static int searchByPositionInMarsdenList(LocationElement loc)
        Search for an observatory by it's geographical position in the Marsden list.
        Parameters:
        loc - Approximate position of the observatory.
        Returns:
        index value of the observatory. -1 is returned if no match is found.

      • searchByCodeInMarsdenList

        public static int searchByCodeInMarsdenList(java.lang.String code)
        Search for an observatory by it's Marsden code. The code is taken from field reference, since field code is it's integer transformation and not officially used.
        Parameters:
        code - Name of the observatory to seach for.
        Returns:
        index value of the observatory. -1 is returned if no match is found.

      • getObservatoryNameInMarsdenList

        public static java.lang.String getObservatoryNameInMarsdenList(int index)
                                                        throws JPARSECException
        Gets the name of an observatory.
        Parameters:
        index - Index for the observatory.
        Returns:
        Name of the observatory.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the index is out of range.
